column5: Beautiful. Looks like a good year. When that salmon bug hits it hits hard and stays I started fishin lake o kings about 5 years ago and now july and august are nothin but silver
Holy crap!!!! EPIC report!!!! Seems like this past year was very good to you. Species Award.
Amazing report! looks like you had a great season
Lots and lots of quality fish there. Good stuff
Great stuff Pete, looks like a great year for sure bud!!
Some very nice fish !!!! And a great season re-cap too !!!! Thanks for sharing and hope next year is even better !!!! Tight-lines.

some enviable fish as always Pete, congrats. The salmon thing can be quite addictive, and I suspect your quest for the 50 inch Muskie will soon share time with the quest for a Tyee. Look forward to your 2014 posts.

Looks like a awesome year Pete congrats.  I love that little tiger Im still hunting for one of them. I think I lost one this year but I did not get a great look so my hunt will start up June 7th again
Nice job, looks like a good year for sure!
Thank you for taking the time for the report it was an excellent year for you.   Art
Ummm...WOW! Thanks for sharing
Right on Pete,  Time on the water treated you well this year.  Cheers, Ron...
Nice year...thanks for sharing!
awesome season pete! i had a great time fishing with you this year. looking forward to the next
Great year...  That 50 is out there waiting for next season...
All big fish. Im loving the esox Well done

A fantastic season and a great recap.  I hear ya on the salmon bug, June to September I find it very difficult to go north of the 401.  lol!  We are really quite fortunate to have such a great and diverse fishery in our province to explore.  Thanks for the recap.
Holy cow!  What's it like not being able to catch small fish??? LOL  Great season!

FOR PETE'S SAKE MAN!!!  lol.  A great multi-species year for ya Pete.  Says a tonne about your fishing prowess that's for sure.  The 50" won't be long for you, cause you gots thems muskies number dood!  GL2014
Wow, that's a season! Love it!  TDunn

Wowza!  You weren't kiddin' Pete ... and I thought these were just some long fish tales ... er fish tails!  Awesome job.  Congrats to you and your bro on a very productive year.  Great review.  I have an identical setup with the Xpedtion ... the rigs and kicker are in the same location ... but there is one major difference.  You must have fish magnets on that thing.  Where did you guys install them, and how many magnets and what brand and you need to also reveal the tesla measure... I'm on to your secrets you know.  Spring time ... how about we get down to the water and chase some around
